name: 黃秀英
objective: Student should have a basic understanding of engineering principles.  This class is to utilize computers to do the experiments on different vehicle/engineering problems.  Student will learn the basic concept of Finite Element Method (FEM), learn how to utilize FEM in Vehicle Engineering to solve problems.  Classes include Geometry modeling, creating FEA models, learning different analysis types (such as Statics, Normal mode, Buckling, and Optimization).
schedule:
1) Syllabus and Introduction
2) 補假
3) Manually Creating Finite Element Model
4) 1-D Geometry, Element and General Quality Check
5) 2-D Geometry, Element and General Quality Check
6) 3-D Geometry, Element and General Quality Check
7) 1-D Finite Element (including Mesh, Material, Property, Load and Boundary Condition), Normal Mode Analysis & FEA model Check
8) 2-D Finite Element Normal Mode Analysis & model Check
9) Midterm Exam
10) 3-D Finite Element Normal Mode Analysis & model Check
11) Static Analysis and Retrieving Results
12) Normal Model & Force Vibration Analysis
13) Buckling Analysis
14) Multiple Analysis Types
15) Optimization
16) Other Finite Element Analyses
17) Project Presentation (1)
18) Project Presentation (2)
